intro: Chailletia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban chailletia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
